title: [Large-scale] Interaction Learning Environment Design Based on Conversation Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and practical experience in professional fields
context.additional_context: Mobile Learning Environment Using Digital Devices for Mid-Level University Students in Healthcare, Legal, and Technical Fields

learning_goals: Interactional learning scenarios are designed by applying principles of conversation theory.

Learners will analyze feedback received from three peer learners using the reflective practice process (Plan-Do-Review) during a 1-week intensive short course and propose two learning design improvements in a written report.

Learners will analyze three or more learning design patterns (e.g., repeated experiments, control group setup, variable manipulation) in scientific experiment design and submit an experimental protocol applying two modified patterns to a given real-world case (e.g., chemical reaction rate experiment).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
